intro: Vasconcellea palandensis, commonly known as the Palandénsis waxplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. Vasconcellea palandensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique fruit structure.
